data.1: AN INQUIRER ASKED for the affliction that is to come
data.2: Upon the infidels -- which none would be able to repel --
data.3: From God, the Lord of the steps (of progression),
data.4: To whom the angels and the soul take a day to ascend, whose length is fifty thousand years.
data.6: They surely take it to be far away,
data.7: But We see it very near.
data.8: The day the sky becomes like molten brass,
data.9: The mountains like the tufts of (carded) wool,
data.10: And no friend inquires after friend
data.11: Though within sight of one another. The sinner would like to ransom himself from the torment of that Day by offering his sons,
data.13: And his family who had stood by him,
data.14: And all those who are on the earth, to save himself.
data.15: But never. It is pure white flame
data.17: It will summon whoever turns his back and flees,
data.19: Surely man is greedy by nature.
data.20: If evil befalls him he is perturbed;
data.21: If good comes to him he holds back his hand,
data.22: Except those who closely follow (the Book of God),
data.24: In whose wealth a due share is included
data.25: For the needy and those dispossessed,
data.26: And those who believe in the Day of Judgement,
data.27: And those who fear the punishment of their Lord, --
data.28: Surely no one can be secure from the punishment of his Lord, --
data.29: And those who guard their sex except from their wives and women slaves of old
data.31: But those who seek more than this will be transgressors;
data.32: And those who fulfil their trusts and covenants,
data.34: And those who are mindful of their moral obligations.
data.35: They will live in gardens with honour.
data.36: What is the matter with unbelievers that they stare at you with fixed gazes and hasten towards you
data.38: Does every one of them wish to enter the garden of tranquility?
data.39: Never so. We have created them from what they know.
data.40: So I swear by the Lord of the Easts and the Wests that We are certainly able
data.41: To bring better people than they in their place; and they will not be able to thwart Us.
data.42: So leave them to their vain disputes and amusement till they meet their day (of reckoning) promised them,
data.43: The day when they will come out of their graves in all haste as though rushing to their altars,
data.44: Eyes lowered, shame attending. That is the day they have been promised!
